Message.Title: Y would Dell drop to 9$/shr ?
Message.Msg: if the majority wotes against the deal it means they are willing to keep their shares .... Icahn and Southeastern will obviously keep shares as well .... M.Dell and Silver Lake will dump their shares ???? I doubt it ! For a 40% downrisk (9$/shr as Bashford assumes ) there would have to be a huge sell off .... Those who don't believe in Dell's turnaroud or think Dell is a dead money have already sold their shares .... Dell is a profitable company and declared even a dividend a year or so before M.Dell anounced his plan to take the company private ..... (what a curiosity ! ) Dell did several acquisitions ...( on shareholders expence by the way ) Bashford .... tell us on what basis do you assume the price will drop to 9$ where will all this huge sell off come from .... if the deal doesn't go through .... and please ... don't tell me the PC bussines is shrinking .... PC bussines is only a fraction of Dell's busines.... and you know that !
don't believe the lies and scare tactics from Michael Dell and the BOD.

Dell's current price, as it has been for many months now, is over inflated due to the proposed $13.65 buyout. Prior to buyout rumors DELL stock traded in the $8 to $10 per share range, and since that time Dell's business operational results have deteriorated. Hope this helps.
you didn't answer my question .... who will be dumping dell shares then .... ?

Message.Title: Deal will not be approved
Message.Msg: The only ones to benefit are the ones that are destroying this company. People that want this deal are liars. Vote your proxie to southeastern

Message.Title: market signaling the deal gets done
Message.Msg: closing the gap, vote is next week still time to go long if you want in at a price below what icon bought at

@hogman You are right. Approval needs a majority of the votes eligible to vote. No vote means a negative vote. Michael Dell's shares are excluded from voting. Therefore, for the proposal to fail, Icahn needs 50% of the eligible votes to vote no, or not vote at all. Icahn is now going for the appraisal rights. Appraisal rights will only be relevant if the buyout is approved. Therefore, even Icahn is thinking the proposal will pass. He is just saving face now. The upside ($14 - 13.65 = $0.35) is more than offset by the potential downside (appraisal could give a lower number than $13.65) plus the legal costs plus the interest cost to hold out for at least 60 days.
Southeastern sold plenty of shares to Icahn at below $13.65. What does it tell you?

Topic.Title: Just wondering who's been buying for the last 2 months ?

Message.Msg: @bash That is exactly the point. This is a controllable event. If you are eligible to vote, here are the choices: 1. Vote yes to get +2% return and to close in 3 weeks. 2. Vote no to get -30% to -40% return in 1 day. Who in the right mind will vote NO? Who, except Icahn & a few crazy dudes?

Message.Title: DRAM $4.1 UP 11%....$30 TARGET.. RALLY REASONS: 1) BLOCKBUSTER MEMORY MANUFACTURING DEAL WITH AMD, 2) MEMORY PRICES UP, 3) NEW TECHNOLOGIES
Message.Msg: Below are the biggest reasons for DRAM huge short and long term upside...... in addition to skyrocketing memory prices (it's main core business for the last several decades) and a tiny $8 million market cap with only 1.4 million shares on the float: 1) AMD and DRAM announced in May (5/8/2013 AMD Press Release and 5/12/2013 DRAMPress Release) that DRAM will begin manufacturing all new AMD Gamer Series memory modules and will provide it's RAMDisk software to drive all AMD Radeon products. The Gamer Series memory is compatible with AMD and Intel platforms, supporting both AMP and XMP memory profiles. Recent reviews rank AMD Gamer Series memory the fastest and more reliable for gaming and other applications requiring super fast processing speeds. "AMD Radeon RG2133 Gamer Series Memory is armed with features designed to outperform the competition on any task," said Roman Kyrychynskyi, product director, Graphics Business Unit, AMD. "Designed with multi-platform compatibility in mind, the AMD Radeon RG2133 brings cutting-edge technology, as well as uncompromising quality and compatibility for PC gamers. "AMD and Dataram have worked together to significantly enhance the dynamic background load-and-save feature in order to create a seamless, non-volatile RAMDisk experience," said Jason Caulkins, CTO, Dataram. "This underscores AMD and Dataram's continued dedication to delivering the highest-performing memory products. 2) Additionally, DRAM is pursuing it's RAMDiisk technology in the energy, banking, simulations, military, medical, and other sectors requiring supe-rfast processing speeds per recent filings

Topic.Title: Just wondering who's been buying for the last 2 months ?

Message.Msg: I do not believe Ichan, Souheastern, or any other underwater DELL share owner will vote against the $13.65 buyout offer. If they do they will become deeper underwater.

For months now you have been positing "vote your proxie to Southeastern". My question is why ? Southeastern is nothing more than a disgruntled shareowner which paid too much for its DELL shares. Southeastern has no capability of helping itself (or other stock holders) in any way, other than voting yes to the current $13.65 buyout offer. Otherwise, DELL stock trades down to the $9.50 per share range and Southeastern's (as well as all stockholders) shares are worth about 30% less than they are today. Southeastern already has a loss on its DELL investment. Does Southeastern really want to make their loss bigger ? Hope this helps.

Message.Title: DRAM $4.19 UP 13%....TARGET $30+…WHY??: 1) NEW AMD MEMORY MANUFACTURING DEAL, 2) MEMORY PRICES WAY UP, 3) MAJOR DIVERSIFICATION
Message.Msg: The two main reasons for DRAM's incredible upside from today’s prices are discussed below. In addition to these recent developments, DRAM will benefit from skyrocketing memory prices (it's main core business for the last several decades). Even before the 2 factors below will come into play in this and future quarters, DRAM was already on the verge of profitability and trading below 0.2 X sales compared to 1.5 sector average. DRAM’s current market cap is a ridiculous $8 million. The float is tiny (1.4 Million shares) and tightly held. 1) AMD and DRAM announced in May (5/8/2013 AMD Press Release and 5/12/2013 DRAMPress Release) that DRAM will begin manufacturing all new AMD Gamer Series memory modules and will provide it's RAMDisk software to drive all AMD Radeon products. The Gamer Series memory is compatible with AMD and Intel platforms, supporting both AMP and XMP memory profiles. Recent reviews rank AMD Gamer Series memory the fastest and more reliable for gaming and other applications requiring super-fast processing speeds. "AMD Radeon RG2133 Gamer Series Memory is armed with features designed to outperform the competition on any task," said Roman Kyrychynskyi, product director, Graphics Business Unit, AMD. "Designed with multi-platform compatibility in mind, the AMD Radeon RG2133 brings cutting-edge technology, as well as uncompromising quality and compatibility for PC gamers. "AMD and Dataram have worked together to significantly enhance the dynamic background load-and-save feature in order to create a seamless, non-volatile RAMDisk experience," said Jason Caulkins, CTO, Dataram. "This underscores AMD and Dataram's continued dedication to delivering the highest-performing memory products. 2) DRAM is also pursuing it's RAMDisk technology in the energy, banking, simulations, military, medical, and other sectors requiring super-fast processing speeds. Upcoming announcements will send DRAM flying past $10 in a hurry.
